Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Redesign MCP for agent workflows, not raw JMAP exposure

Breaking change: Complete API redesign focused on helping agents work with
email rather than exposing raw JMAP protocol.

New tools (6 total, down from 9):
- search: Returns summaries with preview, flags, mailbox - not just IDs
- show: Returns actual body text, truncates >25KB, caches full to disk
- mailboxes: Lists folders with roles and counts
- identities: Lists sending identities
- update: Bulk ops with archive/trash shortcuts
- send: Compose/reply/forward with in_reply_to, forward_of, draft mode

Key improvements:
- One call = useful data (no more search → get_emails → still no body)
- Flexible mailbox input: names ("Inbox"), roles ("archive"), or IDs
- Flexible dates: "yesterday", "2024-01-15", or full ISO 8601
- Human-friendly flags: ["read", "flagged"] not ["$seen", "$flagged"]
- Bodies always included and truncated sanely (25KB inline, full cached)
- Helpful error messages with recovery suggestions

Inspired by https://blog.fsck.com/2025/10/19/mcps-are-not-like-other-apis/
EOF
)")
